definition: to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy
Autumn Harvest Uprising (1927), insurrection in Hunan and Jiangxi provinces led by Mao Zedong
Wuchang Uprising of October 10th, 1911, which led to Sun Yat-sen's Xinhai Revolution and the fall of the Qing dynasty
Huang Chao peasant uprising 875-884 in late Tang, led by Huang Chao
Yellow Turbans Peasant Uprising at the end of later Han (from 184)
Nanchang Uprising, 1st August 1927, the beginning of military revolt by the Communists in the Chinese Civil War
Dazexiang Uprising, another name for 陳勝吳廣起義|陈胜吴广起义[Chen2 Sheng4 Wu2 Guang3 Qi3 yi4]
Chen Sheng Wu Guang Uprising (209 BC), near the end of the Qin dynasty
pinyin: Chen2 Sheng4 Wu2 Guang3 Qi3 yi4

definition: Huanghuagang uprising of 23rd April 1911 in Guangzhou, one a long series of unsuccessful uprisings of Sun Yat-sen's revolutionary party

sentences.english: During this period of 6 years, he quelled the nationalities' Risingup in Yunnan successfully.
sentences.chinese: 其間，他成功地鎮壓了滇東北各族人民起義。

sentences.english: The meeting was brought to a climax by the appearance on the platform of the rebel leader.
sentences.chinese: 起義軍的領袖出現在臺上時會議達到了高潮。

sentences.english: This revolutionary historical novel centres in the Autumn Harvest Uprising.
sentences.chinese: 這部革命歷史小說以秋收起義爲中心內容。

sentences.english: Once the Alliance was truly formed, Mothma wrote the "Declaration of Rebellion."
sentences.chinese: 同盟一旦真正成立，莫思瑪就寫了《起義宣言》。

sentences.english: He fled to Thailand following Burma's pro-democracy uprising in 1988.
sentences.chinese: 在1988年的緬甸民運起義動亂後逃到泰國。

sentences.english: After a prolonged siege, the town was rendered up to the insurgents.
sentences.chinese: 經過長時間包圍之後，這個小鎮已被起義軍攻克。

sentences.english: The year 1871 witnessed the heroic uprising of the Paris Commune.
sentences.chinese: 1871年爆發了英勇的巴黎公社起義。

sentences.english: Jute uprise is banner of brightness of one side of viatic of success of exploration China revolution.
sentences.chinese: 黃麻起義是探索中國革命成功道路的一面光輝旗幟。

sentences.english: Artoo was refurbished in time for the celebration of the Rebel victory.
sentences.chinese: R2被及時修理後，參加了起義軍的勝利慶典。

sentences.english: The insurgents, all intent on the attack, which was imminent, had their backs turned to these two.
sentences.chinese: 起義者對即將到來的猛攻全神貫注，身子都轉了過去。

sentences.english: This novel criticizes the peasants' uprising and sing the praises of the reactionary rulers.
sentences.chinese: 這本小說批判農民起義，但對反動統治者歌功頌德。

sentences.english: The great achievements of Xiangnan Intifada have been recorded in history.
sentences.chinese: 湘南起義偉大功績已經載入史冊。

sentences.english: While the insurgents were reloading their guns, the artillery-men were loading the cannon.
sentences.chinese: 當起義者重上子彈時，炮兵們也在上炮彈。
那支起義部隊被改編了。

sentences.english: There was no cause and effect between the Heaven and Earth Society and the Lin Shuangwen Uprising.
sentences.chinese: 天地會與林爽文起義之間沒有直接的因果關係。

sentences.english: Later, the two hunters schemed to capture the stranded crew of 90 Rebels.
sentences.chinese: 隨後，二人策劃俘獲落難的90名起義軍船員。

definition: Red Army (1928-1937), predecessor of the PLA/(Soviet) Red Army (1917-1946)
Dr Sun Yat-sen (1866-1925), first president of the Republic of China and co-founder of the Guomintang 國民黨|国民党/same as 孫逸仙|孙逸仙
Tongmenghui, Sun Yat-sen's alliance for democracy, founded 1905, became the Guomindang 國民黨|国民党 in 1912
to start/to launch/to unleash/to mobilize/to arouse
